trait.name: Lifeless Guardian
entries: The Blood Golem is immune to charm, fright, and any form of mind control.

trait.name: Fluid Form
entries: The Blood Golem can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Blood Magic Resistance
entries: The Blood Golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects, and resistance to necrotic damage.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The Blood Golem regenerates 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Blood Golem makes two Whip attacks.

action.name: Whip
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Blood Absorption
entries: When a creature within 5 feet of the Blood Golem dies, the Blood Golem regains 10 hit points.

entries.name: Physical Description
entries: Blood Golems are eerie, humanoid forms created from a combination of liquid and coagulated blood. Their bodies are in a constant state of flow, appearing to be made of viscous, ever-shifting blood. Despite their lack of bones, they maintain a humanoid shape through sheer magical force. Their fluid nature grants them a range of liquid-like abilities, making them unique among constructs and undead.

entries.name: Origins and Creation
entries: The Blood Golems were the creations of the House of Snagakins, a lineage of goblin vampire lords who once ruled the old continent. The Snagakins were deeply connected with blood, practicing blood rituals and wielding blood magic. As part of their dark arts, they used the blood of their slaves to create the Blood Golems, intended as tireless guardians for their crypts and catacombs.

The House of Snagakins used these Blood Golems to protect their strongholds, tombs, and places of ritual. After the extinction of the vampire lords, many Blood Golems were left to wander the forgotten catacombs they once guarded, continuing their eternal vigil with no masters to command them.

entries.name: Lore and Behavior
entries: Blood Golems are mindless guardians, eternally patrolling the corridors and chambers of ancient catacombs tied to the House of Snagakins. They attack any intruders on sight, following the last commands of their long-dead masters. Without a will of their own, they are driven solely by the magical compulsion to guard and protect the locations they were set to watch over.

entries.name: Adventure Hooks
entries: Lost Tomb: Adventurers seeking the lost tomb of a Snagakins vampire lord must navigate through a labyrinthine catacomb filled with patrolling Blood Golems.
Ancient Relic: A powerful blood magic artifact lies hidden in a Snagakins vault, guarded by Blood Golems that need to be overcome.,
Undead Scourge: Blood Golems have begun to wander from their ancient posts, terrorizing nearby villages. Adventurers must find the source of the disturbance and put an end to the threat.

trait.name: Adaptive
entries: Gains one trait from its host.

trait.name: Soul Infestation {@recharge 5}
entries: The Saalmolch can attempt to implant a larva into a humanoid or animal it has {@condition grappled}. The target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or become cursed. The cursed target takes {@damage 2d10} psychic damage at the start of each of its turns until the curse is removed or the target reaches 1 hit point, upon which they become {@condition unconscious} and the incubation process begins. This state can be cured by removing the curse for 8 hours.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The Saalmolch has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Saalmolch makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Fey Step {@recharge}
entries: The Saalmolch magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

entries.name: Physical Description
entries: Saalmolchs resemble gigantic bipedal salamanders, with most adults being of Medium size but exhibiting a Powerful Build, making them appear almost Large. The elder Saalmolchs, however, truly achieve Large size. Their young are closer to human size, progressing through various stages of growth. They have smooth, amphibian-like skin that changes color as they age:
Grubs: Brown (resembling bronze)
Young and Adults: Grey (resembling silver)
Elders: Yellow (resembling gold)

entries.name: Origins and Culture
entries: Saalmolchs are an ancient species banished from the Feywild for crimes lost to history. They live in tribal societies, eschewing the complex hierarchies of empires or nations. Despite their feylike origins, they are not true fey and thus belong to a unique category that blends traits of both fey and monstrosities.

entries.name: Lifecycle and Reproduction
entries: Saalmolchs reproduce through a gruesome parasitic process:
Implantation: A Saalmolch implants a larva into a host (animal or humanoid), targeting the host's soul rather than their physical body. This is considered a curse for removal purposes.
Soul Growth: The larva feeds on the host's soul, growing within it. At this stage, the infestation can be removed as a curse.

Physical Manifestation: Once sufficiently grown, the larva transitions to a physical form, consuming the host from within. This stage is typically fatal to the host and no longer curable by simple means. Surgical removal might be possible but would result in severe physical and spiritual damage.

entries.name: Ecology and Behavior
entries: Saalmolchs inhabit secluded, forested areas where they can hunt and implant their larvae without interference. They are apex predators within their ecosystems but prefer to remain hidden, emerging only when necessary to sustain their lifecycle. Their tribal society is tightly knit, with elders guiding the younger members and ensuring the survival of their species.

entries.name: Interaction with Other Species
entries: With Humanoids: Saalmolchs are feared and reviled by humanoid societies due to their horrific reproductive methods. Encounters with them are often fatal or result in severe spiritual and physical trauma.
With Animals: While they can and do implant animals, creating semi-developed Saalmolchs, this practice is rare and looked down upon within their culture.

entries.name: Combat Tactics
entries: Saalmolchs prefer ambush tactics, using their powerful build to overwhelm opponents quickly.
They target lone or weakened individuals for implantation.
Elder Saalmolchs may employ rudimentary tribal magic, using nature-based spells to control their environment.

trait.name: Soul Infestation {@recharge 5}
entries: If the grub hits a creature with its bite attack, it can attempt to implant a larva. The target must succeed on a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw or become cursed.  The cursed target takes {@damage 1d4} psychic damage at the start of each of its turns until the curse is removed or the target reaches 1 hit point, upon which they become {@condition unconscious} and the incubation process begins. This state can be cured by removing the curse for 8 hours.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

Elder Saalmolchs may employ rudimentary tribal magic, using nature-based spells to control their environment.

trait.name: Powerful Build
entries: The Saalmolch counts as one size larger when determining its carrying capacity and the weight it can push, drag, or lift.

trait.name: Adaptive
entries: Gains one trait from its host.

trait.name: Soul Infestation {@recharge 5}
entries: The Saalmolch can attempt to implant a larva into a humanoid or animal it has {@condition grappled}. The target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or become cursed. The cursed target takes {@damage 1d10} psychic damage at the start of each of its turns until the curse is removed or the target reaches 1 hit point, upon which they become {@condition unconscious} and the incubation process begins.This state can be cured by removing the curse for 8 hours.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Saalmolch makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Trampling Charge
entries: If the Molchen Steed moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a hooves attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the Molchen Steed can make another attack with its hooves against it as a bonus action.

trait.name: Adaptive
entries: Gains one trait from its host.

trait.name: Soul Infestation {@recharge 10}
entries: If the steed hits a creature with its bite attack, it can attempt to implant a larva. The target must succeed on a {@dc 6} Constitution saving throw or become cursed.  The cursed target takes {@damage 1d4} psychic damage at the start of each of its turns until the curse is removed or the target reaches 1 hit point, upon which they become {@condition unconscious} and the incubation process begins. This state can be cured by removing the curse for 8 hours.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Molchen Steed makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its hooves.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The Molchen Hound has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the Molchen Hund's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Adaptive
entries: Gains one trait from its host.

trait.name: Soul Infestation {@recharge 10}
entries: If the hound hits a creature with its bite attack, it can attempt to implant a larva. The target must succeed on a {@dc 8} Constitution saving throw or become cursed.  The cursed target takes {@damage 1d4} psychic damage at the start of each of its turns until the curse is removed or the target reaches 1 hit point, upon which they become {@condition unconscious} and the incubation process begins. This state can be cured by removing the curse for 8 hours.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The stalker has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Mist Form
entries: The stalker doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it moves out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Vitality Drain {@recharge 1}
entries: On successful Bite attack the attack's target has to succeed on {@dc 12} Constitution Saving Throw or gain one stack of {@condition exhaustion} stacking up to 5th level of {@condition exhaustion}.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.
